subject: Science
title: Blizzards and Ice Storms
description: A 60-second lesson on Blizzards and Ice Storms.

hook.text: A blizzard isn't just heavy snow. It's wind, cold, and zero visibility combined.

buildup.text: Blizzards form when a strong low-pressure system pulls Arctic air southward.

discovery.text: Sustained winds above 56 km/h and visibility below 400 m define a blizzard.

twist.text: Ice storms are worse. Freezing rain coats everything in a shell of ice.

climax.text: In 1998, an ice storm in Canada brought down 1,000 power transmission towers.

punchline.text: Snow you can shovel. Ice you can't. Ice storms are the real killers.

quiz.question: What defines a blizzard beyond heavy snowfall?
options: Sustained high winds and low visibility
